title: Definitions
text: The macroscopic domain is the realm of everyday things that are large enough to be sensed directly by human sight or touch. Some aspects of the microscopic domain are visible through standard optical microscopes, for example, many biological cells, but most of the subjects in the microscopic domain of chemistry are too small to be seen even with the most advanced microscopes.

title: Scenario
text: We can easily show that $$2$$ lbs of ice will require double the heat of $$1$$ lb of ice. Based on this, select the answer.
